title: Racism, sexism and toxicity
body:
I am absolutely disgusted at the amount of racism and toxicity that happens in game.
Do you have any system in place at all to monitor this?
The amount of abuse that I have seen other players take over their race and sexual orientation is disgusting, and to have played with the same players over and over I want to ask if Riot cares about this?
And if so, is there anything that they actually do?
Players on the server also claim that there is no way that they can get banned and the report system is trash, and I would have to agree with them playing with the same people consistently (over days, weeks) and they are just as sexist and rac

Also, I'd like to recommend changing match making so that groups of people that that are 4 cannot find a game, so that they cannot bully one person and wreak their game - I have seen this as the case on many enemy teams and this is just disgusting - particularly if the person is a female

replies.body: Meh - you're gonna find heroes all over the internet who will abuse you behind their veil of anonymity.  Riot has equipped us with a mute button so that we dont have to listen to their hateful filth. I suggest you use it because nothing will stop people from being abusive tosspots when there is no accountability.

You forgot to mention homophobic.

Im aware of my sexuality why does pointing it out seem to think its gonna offend me?


"You're gay, %%%got"

Well no chit.

Most insults work like this though, if you don't find what they are saying offensive it basically takes all power away from the insult.

 "You're fat!" - "yeah I could probably lose a few kilos"
 "You're a virgin!" - "yeah I'm 13..." or "I just haven't met the right girl yet :3 "
 "You're a noob" - "Yeah I'm pretty bad but I'm trying"
 "You're a %%%!" - "I like men, so what?"

They are mostly quite mild, so I guess learning to deal with it is 1 way to do things. It's internet after all, it can be both a bliss and a pain in the arse.

I do face some very cringe worthy discrimination/insults from time to time, dear lord, aren't they so salty I am drinking my tears in response.

However though, report, mute and move on.

Hey guys. 

I would like to say any for of competitive game or sport for that matter is going to have haters. So it's a part of life and culture at the moment.

Riot do have a strict system that I have seen work like it did for me. I raged at a person and received a 2 week ban which has calmed me down alot cause I know the system is there and works. 

If you ever get up set with a game in general is best to takea break and do something else fora while then play again when you are relaxed. You will play better. 

Good gaming guys. 

Havok

Harden the fuck up, way too many LOL players get upset at the merest slight before screaming they are going to report you and begging for more reports in /all.


 Riot has promoted the same kind of whiney community that feminism is creating in college campuses.

 Need a safe space? Go play Minesweeper.

I think it would be very hard to filter verbal abuse due to the sheer quantity of verbal abuse that goes on on a daily basis. The best way for Riot to combat this is through the report system. But even then it would have very little effect. The only way to reduce the amount of verbal abuse in the League community would be for the community itself to reduce their need and compulsion to resort to verbal abuse.

One thing I would suggest doing is to play with a party. This way you at least have someone you know and can talk to and basically ignore whatever negative comments come your way.
